userreviews.userReview: Blender talk. I bought my Vitamix six years ago. Ever since, I drink a green smoothie every day, and I’ve noticed I am sick far less often. I also notice if I skip a day because I’ll feel sluggish. I worship my Vitamix and have discovered it’s for so much more than just smoothies, as this book illustrates. Some recipes are marked vegan, and there are also vegetarian and meat-centered recipes. Power Blender Revolution is a well-rounded instructional and recipe book for powerful blenders! I bolded each of the recipe sections below and highlighted some I can’t wait to try! The Basics - cheeses, flours, etc. I love grating cheese in my blender because it’s quick and the clean-up is a breeze. 3 Day Juice and Smoothie Cleanses are outlined. It tells you what to eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, and desserts based on recipes in the book. Things to Drink/Whole Food Juices These are great if you have a juicer. Smoothies, Drinks, and SlushiesA couple things I want to try asap:Kiwi Colada Smoothie with canned coconut milk Sugar Cookie Smoothie with dates and cashews Cherry Pecan Pie Smoothie with kaleCoffee Drinks, Matcha Drinks, and CreamersNut Milks and Other Nondairy MilksPistachio Milk! Macadamia Milk! Maple Almond Milk! Blueberry Cashew Milk! Things to Eat! Jams, Butters, SyrupsRecipes for different chia jams and other jams are included. You can make your own salted butter in the blender!Guacamoles, Hummus, and Other Dips and SpreadsDon’t these sound yummy? Avocado Yogurt DipAlmond HummusRaw Ricotta Cheese with macadamia nutsKetchup, Barbecue Sauce, etc. Dressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades, and Spice BlendsI can’t wait to try these two! Watermelon VinaigretteBasil Walnut DressingSmoothie Bowls So popular these days! Soups I love pureeing soups in my Vitamix!Coconut Strawberry Dessert SoupGazpacho Andaluz Entrees from the Blender Pizza, meat dishes, Southwest Veggie Burgers. Vegetable SidesSlaws, relishes Mashed potatoesMashed cauliflowerSour Cream and Onion Kale Chips Muffins, Pancakes, and Other Quick BreadsCheddar Biscuits, Blueberry Almond Scones, Ricotta Oat Pancakes Desserts from the Blender Pina Colada Chia PuddingChocolate Coconut Oat BallsOverall, I’m very pleased with Power Blender Revolution. I have tons of new and inventive ideas and recipes and can’t wait to try them. I wish it had more pictures, but I’m thrilled with the amount of content. Thank you to Vanessa Simkins, Harvard Common Press/Quarto Publishing, and Netgalley for the ARC.

!! NOW AVAILABLE !!Almost five years ago, I bought a Vitamix. I used to use it daily, making healthy smoothies for myself, but I never read or heard about different recipes until recently. When I read my goodreads friend Jennifer’s review for this book, I knew I wanted to read this and find some other ways to introduce some more creative and some more varied recipes. It’s more difficult to obtain quantities of fresh fruit, or even frozen depending upon where you live, but now that warmer days are approaching, I am looking forward to enjoying some fresh local fruit. After reading this book and looking at each and every recipe, most of which I was wishing I was sampling as I was reading the ingredients, I knew this was the incentive I needed.With over 300 recipes, the sections include: Power Blender 7-Day Clean Eating PlanPower Blender 3-Day Juice and Smoothie CleanseWhole Food JuicesSmoothies, Shakes, and SlushiesCoffee Drinks, Matcha Drinks, and CreamersNut Milks and Other Nondairy MilksJames, Butters, and SyrupsGuacamoles, Hummuses, and Other Dips and SpreadsAll-Purpose Sauces, Pestos, and CondimentsDressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades, and Spice BlendsSmoothie BowlsSoupsEntrees From the BlenderVegetables SidesMuffins, Pancakes, and Other Quick BreadsDesserts From the BlenderSorbets, Ice Creams, and PopsiclesBaby Food PuréesMasks, Washes and More for Your Skin: Body Wash, Face Wash, Body Scrub, Body Lotions, Exfoliation Masks, Skin Brightening Masks, Moisture MasksThere’s a balance of vegan and vegetarian and meat-based recipes. There’s also information on using your blender to grind meat, churn butter, and other things, depending on which blender you are using. I’m planning on buying a few copies of this, one for me, and the rest of my family.Many thanks to my goodreads friend Jennifer, whose wonderful, and more detailed, review inspired me to read this. Please check out her review: https://www.goodreads.com/review/show...Pub Date: 08 May 2018Many thanks for the ARC provided by Quarto Publishing Group – Harvard Common Press

Power Blender Revolution is a cookbook that focuses on healthy recipes that can be prepared in a high-speed, high-powered blender. The author has provided over 300 recipes and also walks the reader through helpful skills such as churning butter, grinding meat, and wait for it...making your own homemade, toxic free skincare. Yep! I appreciated that the author provided an introduction to the world of power blenders for newbies or blender owners who might not know just how much their blender is capable of, and I absolutely loved that many of the recipes includes a tidbit of extra information. There really is a wealth of knowledge in this cookbook. Power Blender Revolution covers a variety of dietary/nutritional needs such as vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free, and low-sugar. Each recipe is marked with a symbol to inform the reader which needs are addressed. The recipes and gorgeous photography fall under the following categories:1-Whole Food Juices2-Smoothies, Shakes, and Slushies3-Coffee Drinks, Matcha Drinks, and Creamers4-Nut Milks and Other Nondairy Milks5-Jams, Butters, and Syrups6-Guacamoles, Hummuses, and Other Dips and Spreads7-All-Purpose Sauces, Pestos, and Condiments8-Dressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades, and Spice Blends9-Smoothie Bowls10-Soups11-Entrees from the Blender12-Vegetable Sides13-Muffins, Pancakes, and Other Quick Breads14-Desserts from the Blender15-Sorbets, Ice Creams, and Popsicles16-Baby Food Purees17-Masks, Washes, and More for Your SkinI thought I was already pretty adventurous with my blender. I currently use it to grind oat flour, make salsa, puree ingredients for curries, and of course the common fruit smoothies. But I have to admit this cookbook has me excited. I'm all about homemade versus store-bought when the opportunity and knowledge presents itself and now I have absolutely no excuses. Check it out! Thank you to the following for permitting me access to an advance reader's copy (ARC) of Power Blender Revolution. This generosity did not impact my honesty when rating/reviewing.Source: NetGalleyAuthor: Vanessa SimkinsPublisher: Quarto Publishing Group – Harvard Common PressGenres: Cooking, Food & Wine, Health, Mind & BodyPub Date: May 8, 2018

Thank you so much, Quarto Publishing, for the opportunity to read this book early! When I received the email, I was thrilled because I knew that I would love this book. I didn't know how much though. This book will be my bible. I want to try every recipe in it. I have a lot of food intolerances, but I can easily switch ingredients for most of them. Can't wait to put my Vitamix to good use!!!

Great recipes for a variety of the machines, not just any one particular kind of power blender. Also, not just recipes for smoothies, or for a particular diet style in mind. This cookbook really lets you know all the various things you can do with your blender, reminding you it's not just for making drinks. There are spreads, dips, hummuses, soups, quick breads, etc. There's even a section on masks and washes you can use your power blender to make.

Designed for the Vitamix, Blendtec, Ninja, and other high-speed, high-power blenders, the Power Blender Revolution was created to help you unlock their potential. Including recipes for everything from grains to skincare, this helps you do more than just juicing with your blender.In the introduction, the author describes how in minutes you can make a healthy meal, It then goes on to promise much more. The Benefits Of Using A Power Blender follow with information on How To Use The Book, Tools And Accessories, Essential Advice, and Special Techniques.Next comes the Power Blender 7-Day Clean Eating Plan, providing a seven-day meal plan with recipe names and page numbers. Next is a 3-Day Juice And Smoothie Cleanse if you want a quick detox.The recipes categories are separated into two sections, Things To Drink, and Things To Eat. The recipes categories include:Things To DrinkWhole Food JuicesSmoothies, Shakes, And SlushiesCoffee Drinks, Matcha Drinks, And CreamersNut Milks And Other Nondairy MilksThings To EatJams, Butters, And SyrupsGuacamoles, Hummuses, And Other Dips And SpreadsAll-Purpose Sauces, Pestos, And CondimentsDressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades, And Spice BlendsSmoothie BowlsSoupsEntrées From The BlenderVegetable SidesMuffins, Pancakes, And Other Quick BreadsDesserts From The BlenderSorbets, Ice Creams, And PopsiclesBaby Food Purées10 Masks, Washes, And More For Your SkinEach of the recipes includes a brief introduction, serving sizes, and various labels to identify them as Vegan, Gluten-Free etc. Several also include tips for modifying the recipe, serving or making the best use of your blender.Helpful And SurprisingDisappointingly only a few of the recipes included a picture although each of those is beautifully staged. I found that throughout the book the blending tips were very helpful in providing information that you wouldn’t necessarily find in an instruction manual but which could make the difference in a recipe.Finding the Masks, Washes, And More For Your Skin recipes included in the Things You Can Eat section was very strange. Otherwise, I found the selection to be excellent.The sheer variety of recipes which can be created with a blender was surprising. The fact that you can make so many different things with that one piece of equipment is convenient and helps keep down with the number of dishes you have to clean.See the full review and the recipe for Skin-Brightening Kiwi And Lemon Facial Mask at The RecipesNow! Reviews And Recipes Magazine. This review is written in response to a complimentary hard copy of the book provided by the publisher in hopes of an honest review.

Thanks to Netgalley, the publisher. and the author for allowing me to read and review a digital copy of this book. I appreciated that the author provided an introduction to the world of power blenders for newbies or blender owners who might not know just how much their blender is capable of, and I absolutely loved that many of the recipes include a tidbit of extra information. There really is a wealth of knowledge in this cookbook.

Over 300 great recipes that have replaced more than one meal in my life :) I love quick and easy blender drinks to do for breakfast or a snack and there are some combinations in here I hadn't considered that are going to be favorites going forward.

It’s great to see a book that’s not just a one trip smoothie. This book covers lots of different ways to use a power blender, from baby food to ice creams.This book is split into two main sections: Things to Drink and Things to Eat, plus an Introduction to blending, a 7 day Clean Eating Plan and a 3 Day Juice and Smoothie Cleanse.The Introduction provides useful information on the benefits of using a power blender, tools and accessories required, how to layer the ingredients the best way, plus a host of other information from grinding meat to making your own butter.The Clean Eating Plan and Cleanse provide details on how to prepare your body before you start and suggestions for what to blend for each mealtime.Things to Drink provides a number of recipes to make:Whole Food JuicesSmoothies, Shakes & SlushiesCoffee Drink, Matcha drinks & CreamersNut milks & Other Non-diary Milks.Things to Eat gives many recipes in the following categories:Jams, Butters and SyrupsGuacamoles, Hummuses and other dips & spreadsAll purpose Sauces, Pestos and CondimentsDressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades and Spice BlendsSmoothie Bowls and SoupsEntreesVegetable SidesMuffins, Pancakes and other quick BreadsDesserts plus Sorbets, Ice Creams and PopsiclesBaby Food pureesAlso included in the Things to Eat section is details on how to make Masks, Washes and More for the Skin. Who knew, looking after your skin could be done in a blender too!Each recipe comes with easy to follow steps, metric and imperial measurements and some of the recipes have colour photographs. Some of the ingredients use American terms e.g. cilantro and scallions. A number of recipes do require some conventional cooking in the oven before the ingredients can be blended or heating up once blended.There are tip boxes throughout the book, explaining things from what might damage your blender to a dressings serving suggestion.I received this book from netgalley in return for a honest review.

I received a DIGITAL Advance Reader Copy of this book from #NetGalley in exchange for an honest review. From the publisher --- High-horsepower power blenders are revolutionizing the kitchen habits of millions of people. These fast and convenient devices have many of the functions of the food processor, the juicer, and, of course, the old-fashioned, low-horsepower blender.Vanessa Simkins' Power Blender Revolution is the first general cookbook for power-blender owners who want to get the most use and pleasure from their purchase. Power blenders make juices without sacrificing the nutritious fibre that juicing machines can't handle; they make purees (including baby foods), soups that are silky smooth and light; and they excel with hummus, guacamole, and other dips and spreads.With a little instruction, you’ll be making healthy smoothies for breakfast. When dinner comes rolling around, you’ll know how to make every kind of sauce imaginable, for topping pasta(s), meats, potatoes, vegetables, and more. Time for dessert? You can't mix up a faster mousse, or a faster blend of ice-cream ingredients, in any other kind of machine.With expert tips and tricks that help you choose, use, clean, and maintain your machine, and a bounty of more than 300 creative and tasty recipes, this book is an essential companion for anyone who has invested in a power blender. "Power Blender Revolution is packed full of healthy, vibrant recipes and creative ways to use your blender. Vanessa Simkins proves that your blender isn't just for smoothies. These are recipes you will come back to time and time again.". --Tieghan Gerard, author of Half Baked HarvestSo many healthy recipe ideas! I tend to use a hand blender as I make soup weekly for my elderly parents but this gave me so many more ideas of things "beyond the bowl" :-) ! It looks so easy to get nutrition into you when reading this book: cannot wait to get home and try out these recipes on myself and my parents...and my veggie hating family members.

I was sent a copy of this book through NetGalley and Quarto Publishing Group for an honest review.I loved this marvellous book filled with many new recipes for me to make, and taste. I have managed to try only a few of the wonderful, healthy and tasty recipes when my trusty old blender bit the dust. I have now purchased a brand new one along with a lovely copy of this book in print form. The 7 day cleanse eating plan diet along with the wonderful daily menus, instructions on making and using the following recipes sound great. The smoothie bowl recipes look and sound just like a wonderful way to start a day and the two smoothie recipes I managed to try were, very, very yummy-alicious. This book can be used for those who wish to add more healthy fruit and vegetables to their diet or to just enjoy having a tasty and refreshing beverage or meal. The dip and soup recipes look marvellous as well. They will all be enjoyed in my household. I recommend this book.5+ stars

I received an Advanced Reader Copy from NetGalley for my unbiased opinion of the book. I really loved this book this is the quintessential guide to using your power blender to the fullest!!! Everyone who has this machine, this book is a must! I tried carrot lemonade juice, almond milk, classic pumpkin pie, and flourless walnut brownies all yummy!

Power Blender Revolution is pretty much a high-power blender Bible. It has more than 300 recipes for all sorts of things, from salad dressings to sauces and desserts. Vanessa Simkins has you covered for everything. She also explains how to choose and clean a high-power blender. I'll be honest, I don't have a high-power blender. I only have a rubbish one, but it does the job so I can't justify buying a better one... but I dream of it! One day... I do use mine a lot though, so I'm always looking for new things to try. Usually when I read a cooking book, I take a few notes for the couple of recipes I want to try. I had to stop doing that with this book as there were too many of them. I would love to have a hard copy to use in my kitchen, so I'll most likely buy it!I looked up Vanessa Simkins and found out she has also written books on juices, so if you're into that, definitely check her out.Note - Thanks to NetGalley and Quarto Publishing Group for providing me with a free digital copy in exchange for an honest review.

Thanks to NetGalley for an early copy of this book.The Power Blender Revolution has kept my VitaMix busy for the last week and will continue to keep it busy well into the future. I have used my blender for smoothies and occasionally for soup, but this book showed me how to use it for so much more. This book has two sections to break the recipes into Part 1 Things to Drink and Part 2 Things to Eat. Each recipe starts with a brief introduction describing something about the recipe. The book is filled with vibrant pictures and each recipe notes if it is vegan, gluten free, dairy free, nut free, and/or low sugar to make it easier to use with any diet restrictions. Some of my new favorite recipes (and these are just a sampling of the many recipes in this book) are:Things to Drink:Chapter 1 Whole Food Juices: Strawberry Pineapple Lemonade Juice, Cranberry Juice Crush, Simple Orange Juice, and Red Apple Juice. The apple juice is so much better than traditional store bough apple juice.Chapter 2 Smoothie, Shakes, and Slushies: Berry Oat Breakfast Shake (who knew you could put oatmeal in a smoothie? The chapter also has recipes that include cashews, broccoli, and turmeric…) and Frozen Lemonade Slushie.Chapter 3 Coffee Drinks, Matcha Drinks, and Creamers: this chapter wasn’t for me; I am not a fan of coffee.Chapter 4 Nut Milks and Other Non-Dairy Milks: Cashew Milk, Chocolate Macadamia Milk, and several nut milks with fruit add-ins.Things to Eat:Chapter 5 Jams, Butters, and Syrups: Whipped Garlic Herb Butter and Chocolate Hazelnut Spread.Chapter 6 Guacamoles, Hummuses, and Other Dips and Spreads: Caramelized Sweet Onion Dip, Simple Hummus (and all the hummus varieties), Spicy Cheese Guacamole, and Chicken Spread.Chapter 7 All-Purpose Sauces, Pestos, and Condiments: Classic Ketchup, Cauliflower Alfredo Sauce, Arugula Lemon Pesto (this may be my favorite recipe in the whole book), and Vegan Sour Cream.Chapter 8 Dressings, Vinaigrettes, Marinades, and Spice Blends: Strawberry Vinaigrette (the strawberries just add something amazing), Cilantro Lime Dressing (my new go-to salad dressing), Classic French Dressing, and Turmeric Ginger Vinaigrette.Chapter 9 Smoothie Bowls: Peanut Butter Cup Smoothie Bowl and Lemon Crème Superfood Smoothie Bowl.Chapter 10 Soups: (this is my favorite chapter…soup is so quick and easy in the blender!) Broccoli Cheddar Soup, Black Bean Soup, Spinach and Broccoli Soup, and Tomato, White Bean, and Basil Soup.Chapter 11 Entrees from the Blender: Whole Wheat Margherita Pizza, Cauliflower Crust Pizza, and Mashed Chickpea Lettuce Wrap.Chapter 12 Vegetable Sides: Classic Coleslaw (the blender makes shredding cabbage so easy!) and Cheese and Chive Cauliflower Mash.Chapter 13 Muffins, Pancakes, and Other Quick Breads: Cheddar Biscuits, Classic Crepes, Broccoli and Cheese Frittata, Quinoa Flatbread Pita, and Pao de Queso Cheese Rolls.Chapter 14 Desserts from the Blender: Peanut Butter Chocolates, No Bake Individual Cheesecakes, and Raw Strawberry Cheesecake.Chapter 15: Sorbets, Ice Creams, and Popsicles: Strawberry Sorbet, Pineapple Whip Sorbet, Peach Ice Cream, and Double Chocolate Ice Cream (so easy and so good).Chapter 16: Baby Food Purees: I don’t have a baby so I did not try any of the recipes in this chapter.Chapter 17: Masks, Washes, and More for Your Skin: Avocado Oat Exfoliation Mask and Skin-Brightening Kiwi and Lemon Facial Mask.The only downside to this book for me is I wish there were companion recipes. For instance there is a recipe for Green Enchilada Sauce, but no Enchilada recipe to go with it. I think that would have been a great addition to this book. However, I still feel that if you want to get the most out of your high powered blender, I suggest picking up this book!

Thank to Vanessa Simkins, Quarto Publishing Group – Harvard Common Press, and Netgalley for the advanced reader copy of “Power Blender Revolution: More Than 300 Healthy and Amazing Recipes That Unlock the Full Potential of Your Vitamix, Blendtec, Ninja, or Other High-Speed, High-Power Blender” for an honest review. I love, love, loved this book. I loved first of all that it’s multipurpose across the products, no first come first serve, must have this one device to pass go, from the beginning. I love that at the beginning it tells you everything in this book will be broken down by vegan, gluten-free, dairy-fee, nut-free, and low sugar so that there will be things in here for people from every walk and way of life as well. This book is broken down into drinks & eats, separately. The first covering juices, smoothies, shakes, slashes, coffee, teas, creamers, and any kind of alternative milk you could dream of. The latter is made of jams, butters, syrups, spreads, dips, sauces, pestos, condiments, dressings, marinades, smoothie & soup bowls, entrees, vegetables meal sides, muffins, pancakes, breads, desserts. You’ll even find a section on baby food making and for skin care products! I love the layout of most of the chapters and pages. It could use a few more pictures, and pictures that are not simply 1/4th of a page spread, as they feel a little wedged in and only often enough to be checking a box sometimes, rather than displaying culinary delights to tease the eyes as well as the tongue.

Author Vanessa Simkins has written a well-rounded cookbook that offers tips and recipes on how to get the most out of your high=speed high-power blender. You will find plenty of recipes and color photos in her cookbook called Power Blender Revolution. Some of the recipes you'll find include:Dairy-Free Strawberry MilkshakeCoconut CreamerIced Caramel FrappeRice MilkCinnamon Apple ButterClassic KetchupSweet Vegan Ranch DressingGinger Carrot SoupPeach Ice Cream (Makes 2 cups perfect for serving up a sweet for a small group of diners)Double Chocolate Ice Cream (Makes 1 cup perfect for dessert for two)Sweet Potato Puree (baby food)Honey Face Wash (a beauty item to cleanse the face)Be aware you will find plenty of recipes that use nuts. If you have a nut allergy, you might want to borrow the book first to see if the recipes will work for you.Recommend.Review written after downloading a galley from Net Galley.

This is amazing! It has so much information and so many recipes. Everything is in different sections, smoothies, food and it includes a clean eating and a cleanse plan. Plus skin and body washes. The layout is brilliant and the photos are fantastic. It even has UK measurements. A brilliant book. Thanks to netgalley for letting me read this.
Finally a book a filled with #Keto and # friendly recipes for salad dressings, soups, side dishes and super simple desserts that use my VitaMix! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I bought myself a little power blender. It sits on my counter-top, its tiny footprint unobtrusive while its larger food-processer cousin languishes in a cupboard. ‘Power Blender Revolution’ is the perfect companion for it. Bright, clear photos; simple recipes. This is everyday stuff. Smoothies, juices, soups and dips – of course – but also ice-creams, nut milks and even beauty products. These power blenders crush ice, so why didn’t I think of using it to make slushies? And without the additives you’d rather your kids didn’t have. On the downside, there’s a small section on ‘clean-eating’ and a juice ‘cleanse’ – fine if you believe in that stuff – I found I could easily ignore it. Last week I discovered that the shop-bought hummus I’d intended to use was finished. Aha , I thought, I’ll make my own! Then I discovered I didn’t have any chickpeas (well-organised as ever) but I did have a carton of black beans. In a fraction of the time it’d take to go to the shop, I whipped up Simkins’ Spicy Black Bean Dip – and very nice it was too. Thanks to Quarto / Harvard Common Press and Netgalley for this advanced reader copy. Visit my blog at https://mypertopinions.blogspot.co.uk/

Great for Blender newbies and those who had a Vitamix for years like me:)Great book with loads of useful staple recipes. If you don't have a blender book at home this is the one to get.ARC provided via the publisher in exchange for an honest review.

Practicalmomsense.com looks forward to the opportunity to review, "Power Blender Revolution: More Than 300 Healthy and Amazing Recipes That Unlock the Full Potential of Your Vitamix, Blendtec, Ninja, or Other High-Speed, High-Power Blender" by Vanessa Simkins. Our family enjoys making smoothies, as a way to get the nutrients we need in our daily diet. I am very interested in finding our more about different recipes we can try and how to maximize the different ways we can use our blender.

#PowerBlenderRevolution #NetGalleyDelicious, easy and fast recipes to create with a blender. The collection is diversified: butters, ice cream, muffins, smoothies, sauces and other fantastic creations.

description: High-horsepower power blenders are revolutionizing the kitchen habits of millions of people. These fast and convenient devices have many of the functions of the food processor, the juicer, and, of course, the old-fashioned, low-horsepower blender. Vanessa Simkins' Power Blender Revolution is the first general cookbook for power-blender owners who want to get the most use and pleasure from their purchase. Power blenders make juices without sacrificing the nutritious fiber that juicing machines can't handle; they make purees (including baby foods), soups that are silky smooth and light; and they excel with hummus, guacamole, and other dips and spreads. With a little instruction, you’ll be making healthy smoothies for breakfast. When dinner comes rolling around, you’ll know how to make every kind of sauce imaginable, for topping pastas, meats, potatoes, vegetables, and more. Time for dessert? You can't mix up a faster mousse, or a faster blend of ice-cream ingredients, in any other kind of machine. With expert tips and tricks that help you choose, use, clean, and maintain your machine, and a bounty of more than 300 creative and tasty recipes, this book is an essential companion for anyone who has invested in a power blender.    "Power Blender Revolution is packed full of healthy, vibrant recipes and creative ways to use your blender. Vanessa Simkins proves that your blender isn't just for smoothies. These are recipes you will come back to time and time again.". --Tieghan Gerard, author of Half Baked Harvest
title: Power Blender Revolution: More Than 300 Healthy and Amazing Recipes That Unlock the Full Potential of Your Vitamix, Blendtec, Ninja, or Other High-Speed, High-Power Blender
